abstract: Editorial holds Senate Republicans’ unanimous decision to kill President Obama’s jobs bill was breathtaking act of economic vandalism; holds Republicans are offering no actual economic plans of their own, only tired slogans; says record is increasingly clear about who is advocating real ideas and who is selling an empty vessel.
snippet: Senate Republicans’ unanimous decision to kill President Obama’s jobs bill was a breathtaking act of economic vandalism, but they offer no plan of their own.
lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans’ unanimous decision to kill President Obama’s jobs bill was a breathtaking act of economic vandalism, but they offer no plan of their own.

headline.main: No Jobs Bill, and No Ideas
headline.print_headline: No Jobs Bill, and No Ideas: Republicans are good at shooting down useful economic plans, but have none of their own
headline.seo: No Jobs Bill, and No Ideas
